model

Class MShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.MShape
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MCircle, MRectangle

    public class MShape
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for geometric shapes. Each shape has an explicit origin represented by a point: (x,y).
    Version:
    1.00 27 Apr 2009
    Author:
    Gert Veltink, updated Agathe Merceron

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected double xOrigin
      x-coordinate of the origin.
      protected double yOrigin
      y-coordinate of the origin.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MShape(double x, double y)
      Constructor for a shape taking as argument the two coordinates of the origin.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double area()
      calculate the area of a shape. the base shape is just point so it has no area.
      double circumference()
      calculate the circumference of a shape. the base shape is just point so it has no circumference.
      double getXOrigin()
      returns the x-origin of this shape.
      double getYOrigin()
      returns the y-origin of this shape.
      java.lang.String origin()
      constructs a textual representation of the origin in the form: "(x, y)"
      java.lang.String toString()
      constructs a textual representation of the object.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait
